document.title: Cloudinary in NextJs - upload & delete images
document.description: Simplifying Image Management in Next.js with Cloudinary - Uploading and deleting Images.

document.title: Real-time Notifications with Pusher in Next.js
document.description: How to use Pusher in a Next.js app to receive notifications in real-time?

Pusher uses WebSockets to establish a persistent, bidirectional connection between the client and server. `]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/safi/whoami-v2/src/app/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-ee02b759-0284-45dd-a1ca-a728a425656d.mdx",lineNumber:57,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(a.pre,{children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(a.code,{className:"language-jsx",children:`import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import Pusher from 'pusher-js';

const pusher = new Pusher(process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_PUSHER_KEY, {
  cluster: process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_PUSHER_CLUSTER,
});

const Notifications = () => {
  const [notifications, setNotifications] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const channel = pusher.subscribe(YOUR_CHANNEL_NAME);

    channel.bind(YOUR_EVENT_NAME, data => {
      setNotifications([...notifications, data]);
    });

    return () => {
      pusher.unsubscribe(YOUR_CHANNEL_NAME);
    };
  }, [notifications]);

  return (
    <div>
      <h2>Notifications</h2>
      <ul>
        {notifications.map(notification => (
          <li key={notification.id}>{notification.message}</li>
        ))}
      </ul>
    </div>
  );
};

export default Notifications;

`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/safi/whoami-v2/src/app/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-ee02b759-0284-45dd-a1ca-a728a425656d.mdx",lineNumber:60,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/safi/whoami-v2/src/app/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-ee02b759-0284-45dd-a1ca-a728a425656d.mdx",lineNumber:60,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:["In this example, we're creating a new Pusher instance and subscribing to a channel named \u2018YOUR_CHANNEL_NAME\u2019.  We're then binding an event listener to the \u2018YOUR_EVENT_NAME\u2019 event on the channel, which will be triggered whenever a new notification is received. When a new notification is received, we're updating the state of our app using ",(0,i.jsxDEV)(a.code,{children:"useState"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/safi/whoami-v2/src/app/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-ee02b759-0284-45dd-a1ca-a728a425656d.mdx",lineNumber:98,columnNumber:340},this),". We're then rendering the received notifications in a list."]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/safi/whoami-v2/src/app/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-ee02b759-0284-45dd-a1ca-a728a425656d.mdx",lineNumber:98,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,i.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"In this tutorial, we explored how to set up Pusher in a Next.js app and receive notifications in real-time. Using Pusher in a Next.js app is an easy way to add real-time capabilities to your application, and it can greatly enhance the user experience. By following the steps outlined in this tutorial, you can easily integrate Pusher into your own Next.js projects and enable real-time notifications for your users."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/safi/whoami-v2/src/app/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-ee02b759-0284-45dd-a1ca-a728a425656d.mdx",lineNumber:103,columnNumber:1},this)]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/safi/whoami-v2/src/app/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-ee02b759-0284-45dd-a1ca-a728a425656d.mdx",lineNumber:1,columnNumber:1},this)}function _r(d={}){let{wrapper:a}=d.components||{};return a?(0,i.jsxDEV)(a,Object.assign({},d,{children:(0,i.jsxDEV)(Te,d,void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/safi/whoami-v2/src/app/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-ee02b759-0284-45dd-a1ca-a728a425656d.mdx"},this)}),void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/safi/whoami-v2/src/app/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-ee02b759-0284-45dd-a1ca-a728a425656d.mdx"},this):Te(d)}var vr=_r;return hr(yr);})();
